arm_group.description: Healthy volounteers with no previous medical history, age between 20-40. Both male and female. Subjects are provided extensive information about the study and the obligations and expectations included. All subjects sign a witnessed informed consent before inclusion.

brief_summary.textblock:
Real-time comparison of three different bedside strokevolumemeasurements (arterial waveform
      analysis, eosofageal doppler and 2D transthoracal ultrasound) validated against cardiac
      magnetic resonance imaging (CMRI)

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-time Comparison of Left Ventricular Strokevolume Measurement by Four Different Methods
clinical_study.condition: Difference in Measured Results Using Four Different Strokevolume Measurements Simultaneously.

detailed_description.textblock:
20 healthy volounteers between age of 20-40 years, no previous medical history undergo
      simoultaneous left ventrikular strokevolume measurements using three different methods at
      rest. After datasampling and without moving, the subject then undergo Cardiac Magnetic
      Resonance Imaging with 2D-throughplane and cine tecnology for validation of volume
      measurements. The data is then analyzed using Bland-Altman calculation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:Healthy volounteers age 20-40, BMI < 30, weight < 100 kg, no
        medications, sinus rythm on ECG, no contra-indications for MRI, ability to give written
        informed consent.

        -

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Heart and/or vascular disease such as angina pectoris, arrythmias, claudicatio
             intermittens e g.

          -  Diseases in gastrointestinal tract or nose.

          -  Coagulopathies

          -  Pregnancy

          -  Allergys for local anaesthetics

          -  Claustrofobia

intervention.intervention_name: Arterial waveform analysis, esofageal doppler, transthoracal cardiac ultrasound, Cardiac magnetic resonance imaging.

facility.name: Departement for intensive care medicine, Universitetssjukhuset

clinical_study.official_title: Real-time Comparison of Left Ventricular Strokevolume Measurement by Four Different Methods

primary_outcome.measure: Limits of agreement (LOA) is less than 30% using CMRI as validation for each individual measurement of left ventricular stroke volume.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
